intro: Conyza subcapitata, commonly known as the common ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It features a slender, branching stem covered with fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in open fields. Conyza subcapitata is known for its ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds, making it a common weed in many regions.
